column5: Sonny and Domenic blasted off from Hammy Town around 5:30pm Yesterday to head to Dunnville for a little Cat fishing ...the smiles tell the rest .thanks Sonny Domenic & Jen for joining me last night  ..Fishmaster Take a Kid Fishing or Hunting so you don't have to hunt for your Kids
nothing beats the smile on a kids face fishing!

seeing those smiles on the kids after catching the fish makes everything seem less important at the time. It looks like you two had a blast and those catfish are pretty big. Nice pics and keep up the great fishing.

All i can say is that i can't thank you enough...although i didn't actually catch any myself there is not a better feeling then watching my son catch fish and enjoy it!!  I still have memories of my father and myself fishing when i was a child...and i hope this is one of those memories for my son,,,with many more to come,,,thank you steve as my son thanks you with his smile!!!
....Good stuff guys. I hope this weather holds out so I can take my son down there tomorrow.

WTG man......... Those are exellent photo's....they'll be keepsakes quicker then you realize. I miss them days with my boys just looking at your photos...thanks for that! When I fish with my boys now Im generally the passenger/netman..lol
Little boys love to be with their Daddy....He is one happy lille man...thanks for sharing.
Great Fish guys  Thats what its all about !!!  Al Spoonmaster lures
Great job guys.  Nice to see the smiles on the kids faces.  Good to see the big cats are still hanging around in the river.  Cheers  Craig
When I was a kid, I didn't wait around for an adult to take me fishin'.
My son is going to be two this summer, can't wait to get him out.

Sounds like the perfect age to get him hooked!!!!!  I bought my 4 year old niece a "Dora the Explorer" fishing rod last year and that is pretty much all she talks about...  "Papa, when are you and uncle Bill going to take me fishing again?"  Can't beat it.
Awesome! the big smile says it all! nothing like taking little guys fishing!
Nice fish and good for you on getting the kids involved. Nice to see them out there enjoying it all.  Mike
